We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in\xa0Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><p>This job is based in San Jose and mainly focus on e-beam inspection system.</p><p></p><p><b>Job Mission</b></p><p>As SEM ELEC architect, your mission is to specify, design, realize and verify functional design of SEM electronics for our e-beam inspection and metrology system. This job also serves as the major interface towards system engineering (SE), SEM EO (electron optics) and other related functions.</p><p></p><p><i>This position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require the Company to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.</i></p><p></p><p><b>Job Description</b></p><ul><li>Deliver architecture design of SEM ELEC.</li><li>Deliver functional specification (EPS), test specification (TPS), design specification (EDS), qualification document (TAR) and other documentations for SEM ELEC related functionalities, including safety, reliability, accessibility, serviceability, manufacturability and cost control.</li><li>Review and negotiate with SE, SEM architects, SEM EO and other related functions to agree on the requirements towards SEM ELEC and the interfaces.</li><li>Review and work within SEM ELEC to finalize design and implementation. Ensure designs meet required standard and design rules.</li><li>Provide functional overview, block diagram, connection requirement, power supply requirement and module list describing SEM ELEC functionality towards SEM E-Layout, create and release SEM ELEC BOM.</li><li>Lead the integration, function and performance verification and mitigation of SEM ELEC on system.</li><li>Support the integration and related trouble shooting activities of SEM functions.</li><li>Provide input for SEM ELEC and also SEM function roadmap, including functionality, performance, volume &amp; layout, verification &amp; diagnosis, etc.</li><li>Together with function and module owners, to lead and drive the SEM ELEC function roadmap.</li><li>Support SEM TestRig design, implementation, integration and verification.</li><li>Other related works to enable SEM functionality and performance.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Education </b></p><p>Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering with 10 years of relevant work experience or Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering with 12 years of relevant work experience.</p><p></p><p><b>Experience</b></p><ul><li>Minimum 8 years of electronics or electrical hands-on design experience.</li><li>Experience as architect with multi-disciplinary system design is strongly preferred.</li><li>Has experience with general electrical engineering principles and electrical development methods and processes.</li><li>Has knowledge of analog (voltage and current) driver design to meet certain BW/SR/DR/Ripple/Load requirements. {'company': 'ASML', 'job_id': 'J-00302899', 'title': 'CS EU EUV Upgrade Install and Relocation Engineer', 'department': ['Customer Support'], 'location': 'Leixlip, Ireland', 'degree': ['Bachelor', 'Master'], 'experience_level': ['0-1 year'], 'description': '<p><b>Introduction to the job</b></p><p>Do you want to work on engineering hands-on challenges in an international environment? Do you want to be part of the expanding European team working on the newest ASML EUV machines? Join ASML and become part of group of young international System Install \xa0&amp; service Engineers in Europe. In this role you build the machine from scratch as an advanced LEGO sculpture at the Multiple customer sites across Europe , within specifications, on-time, with quality exceeding the customers’ expectations. Before you start you will get an international one-year training program in Europe &amp; Asia.</p><p>\xa0</p><p>As a System Install Engineer you will be working at the frontiers of technology. The goal of your job is to install leading edge lithographic systems, at the customer site, within specifications, on time, with quality exceeding the customers’ expectations.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Job Description</u></p><p>Our Customers across European Region are currently expanding their factories in Ireland, Israel, Germany and Belgium. They are working hard to make their facilities ready to produce microchips with our newest EUV machines, therefore our team will be busy with Installing, Upgrading and Relocating systems throughout the following years.<br />This program consist of 3 phases. First two phases of one year and the last one indefinitely.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Phase 1: One-year international training program</u></p><p>Given the complexity of our machines you will first get an international one-year training program. You will be trained to learn all the details to make sure you can fully integrate our team and gain knowledge on the newest EUV machines. A part of the training program will be done in our locations around the world, (sites can be found in Asia (Taiwan), USA and other European countries). Every site that is already equipped with EUV machines is a potential site where you will be able to get on-the-job training.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Phase 2: Install, Upgrade and Relocate EUV machines</u><br />New EUV machines needs to be installed on sites, Current running machines sometimes needs to be upgraded and de-installed to be shipped to other locations, it&#39;s our teams job to make sure it all goes according the timelines set by the customer, following all safety and site requirements and be ready for any help requests that might be needed from other departments,\xa0</p><p>\xa0</p><p>Within System Install (SIE) there are different specializations for an engineer. Based on your background and preferences we will match you to a specific specialization:\xa0 \xa0</p><ul><li>The pre-install team. They make sure that within the factory of the customer everything is in place before the machine arrives, including facilitating the requirements. </li><li>The mechanical install engineer will be onsite with the customer when the de-assembled machine arrives. Within approximately a time span of 3 weeks the machine will be assembled. Hands-on skills are highly preferred. The machine will be moved in, unpacked, unlocked and all modules mechanically installed. The system will be powered on and checked how everything works, to diagnose faults and solve system failures.</li><li>Then the last type of system install engineer will follow and begins the integration and qualification process. Main focus is calibrating and testing the system including system acceptance test, plus fault diagnose and solving system failures. When all tests prove the agreed performance, the install is done and the customer support team will take over.</li></ul><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Phase 3: Continue career development</u></p><p>When all the machines are installed and running, there are opportunities to continue your career path in support of customers around Europe and elsewhere, Alternatively there will also be opportunities to become an EUV expert: where you know all the in’s-and-out’s of our equipment, or you can grow from the role of system install engineer to the role of Generalist, Expert, Coordinator, Shift lead and other exciting technical development paths. </p><p>\xa0</p><p><i>This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.</i></p><p>\xa0</p><p><b>Role and responsibilities</b></p><p><u>Problem analysis and approach</u></p><p>Gather all information relevant for the problem, analyze using available means, gather additional diagnostic info if needed, decide on initial approach to solve problem and execute, consult with others.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Problem handovers and routing</u></p><p>Handover problem or problem aspects to others (2nd line support), document and package all data relevant for problem resolution.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Installation</u></p><p>Install equipment at customers locations.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Upgrade</u></p><p>Execute hardware installation and perform system setup/recovery for upgrade packages. Provide feedback during execution in order to improve cycle time and performance.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Relocations</u></p><p>De-Install equipment at customers locations, unload components, inspect for damage, Disassemble, Document all relevant information and transfer along with the machine.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Process Optimization</u></p><p>Signal gaps and improvement opportunities and reports it to the relevant stakeholders</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Training / advice</u></p><p>Explain appropriate actions to users to correct malfunctions, train customers in use and routine maintenance of equipment, recommend changes in user procedures when needed.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Knowledge build-up and transfer</u></p><p>Maintain and broaden own knowledge, shares best known methods within the work group.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Coaching</u></p><p>Provide appropriate support and assistance to less experienced engineers on first tasks.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><b>Education and experience</b></p><p>A Bachelor or Master degree in a technical related study. Preferably (but not exclusively) in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Electronics, Physics, Mechatronics.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><b>Skills</b></p><ul><li>Excellent communication skills with a focus in understanding , supporting and influencing others.</li><li>Safety first mentality</li><li>Quality “first time right” philosophy.</li><li>Passion for hands on engineering challenges</li><li>Detail orientation without losing track of the bigger picture</li><li>Self steering</li><li>Good team player</li></ul><p>\xa0</p><p><b>Other information</b></p><p><u>Shift schedule:</u></p><p>You will work in a 12-hour shift schedule (24/7),\xa0 with attractive shift allowances and overtime compensation for our shift structure.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><u>Travel</u><b>:</b></p><p>Initially &gt; 80% international travel (Required for training),<br />Once qualified &gt; up to 70%</p><p>\xa0</p><p>EOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability</p><p>\xa0</p><p>Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? In MDEV DUV Mechanical Imaging group, TLs work together with the Product Owner (PO) and Mechanical Architect of the team and report to the Group Lead (GL).</p><p>The Team Leader is responsible for the following:</p><ul><li>Being responsible for the output and the quality of the team. Develop &amp; Perform, Goal Setting, Talent Management) , in close collaboration with Group Leader (GL)</li><li>Ensures well-being of the team members</li><li>Facilitates the team rituals and contributes to ASML Development Model (ADM) Train activities</li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Education and experience</b></h2><ul><li>Master in Mechanical Engineering, preferably with a specialization in Precision, Mechatronics, Industrialization.\xa0</li><li>At least 10 years of relevant working experience within Mechanical Engineering domain.\xa0</li><li>At least 2 years of experience in leading design teams of 5 engineers and above.\xa0</li><li>Excellent knowledge in the field of design and manufacturing of mechanical parts.\xa0</li><li>Skilled in technical, correct and effective communication with suppliers.\xa0</li><li>Experienced in evaluating FEM / mechanical analysis results.\xa0</li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Skills\xa0</b></h2><ul><li>Highly motivated team player with excellent social, coordination and communication skills.\xa0</li><li>Ability to work in an international multicultural setting. The cluster Mechanical Development is designing, building and testing mechanical systems and sub-systems which are fitted into the end products. In this cluster, departments with different competences are responsible for the various modules of the ASML products. Each department consists of discipline and/or function oriented groups where emphasis lies on particular competences or functions in ASML equipment.\u202f\xa0</p><p>#MDspotlightjob\xa0</p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p><i>This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the</i> <i>United States</i> <i>Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). {'company': 'ASML', 'job_id': 'J-00314065', 'title': 'Cloud Security Specialist', 'department': ['IT'], 'location': 'San Jose, US', 'degree': ['Bachelor', 'Master'], 'experience_level': ['4-9 years'], 'description': '<p><b>Introduction</b></p><p>ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market, and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in\xa0Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><p><b>Job Mission</b></p><p>This role is part of the Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE). The CCoE is a global Agile Release Train, with presence in the Netherlands, US and East-Europe. The vision is to provide a flexible and reliable cloud platform to enable accelerated and sustainable adoption of cloud across ASML, and maximizing the ability to realize its benefits, while reducing risks. In this role you will work closely together with Products Owners, Cloud &amp; Security Architects and Cloud Engineers to help build secure and robust enterprise-grade cloud platforms.</p><p></p><p>The CCoE US Team is responsible for cloud onboarding and solutioning to guide other ASML DevOps teams in their onboarding journey to cloud, which includes aspects around architecture, cost management and security. During the cloud onboarding process there are steps that demand a Security Expert to evaluate and approve the design/solution to ensure that all workloads are fully compliant when they move to production.</p><p></p><p>When workloads are in ‘run’, the CCoE US Team monitors security vulnerabilities and address those to Workload DevOps teams, ensuring that the given recommendations are actionable and get prioritized. Operational requests related to, or with a possible impact on our security posture, are also in scope of this role. There are topics that are extremely relevant for the US region, like export control, Engineering Top Secrets in Cloud and Generative AI in Cloud. These topics demand security expertise from CCoE; we help ensure workload teams are compliant and have all cloud security requirements in place. As these topics are relatively new, a dedicated Security Architect is paramount in the US Region, ensuring we stay ahead of all requirements.</p><p></p><p>The Cloud Security Specialist will be responsible for the protection of ASML’s information, Intellectual Property (IP) and assets, and that of ASML’s customers and suppliers developed and used within ASML’s Public cloud (IaaS, PaaS), through the set-up and/or alignment of ASML Information Security strategies and security standards/ guidelines while interfacing with the Business, and enforcing system, application and access security controls within the cloud. This position will continuously assess and report upon the effectiveness of the security controls of the cloud at people, process and technology level.</p><p></p><p></p><p><b>Duties and Responsibilities</b></p><ul><li>Serve as the single point of contact for security subjects within the Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) US Team.</li><li>Be a linking pin between CCoE US and regional security &amp; risk.</li><li>Be the extension and contact person of the CCoE security team (mostly based in Netherlands) for the US region</li><li>Support in updating and maintaining the Cloud Security Framework.</li><li>Develop, design and maintain Cloud security standards, guidelines and procedures to assure effective secured Cloud services and data protection within the IaaS / PaaS domain.</li><li>Regularly assess Cloud workloads (people, process, technology) on security compliance and report upon findings, conclusions and propose risk reducing measures within the CCoE workload process and during the lifetime of cloud workloads.</li><li>Assess and support mitigation of the risks associated to ASML’s public cloud to assure a continuously adequate level of security.</li><li>Build excellent working relationships within ASML’s CCoE members and all cloud service users, including security officers and developers of new cloud services.</li><li>Support ASML Security Incident Response Team (SIRT) activities with response on any major IT security incidents related to ASML’s IAAS / PAAS domain.</li><li>Provide cyber security expertise in the analysis, assessment, development, and evaluation of security solutions and architectures to secure applications, operating systems, databases, and networks.</li><li>Hybrid role: 3 days per week in office (San Jose), 2 days per week remote, but with a flexible mindset &amp; willing to be present more if deadlines, events, or customer facing meetings require it.</li><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Education and Experience </b></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s/master’s degree in IT, Business Management, Computer Science or Electronics.</li><li>Must have 8&#43; years of templates).\xa0</li><li>Conducting Security Assessments (reactive) and Security Risk Assessments (proactive) within a Cloud environment.</li><li>Scrum/Scaled Agile Framework We design, develop, integrate, market, and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in\xa0Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><p>We are looking an Embedded Software Architect who has a passion for designing and coding software for a distributed control system.\xa0\xa0Join ASML and you will be joining a team that operates in a fast-paced, uniquely innovative and challenging environment to create world class DUV technology within ASML.\u200b</p><p>You will work with software and control system engineers as you develop software in response to the system requirement and design documents. You will get to participate in designing for excellence, keeping in mind reusability, modularity, simplicity, and maintainability. In addition you will determine the best test methodologies, and contribute in all aspects of the software development, build, test and release cycle.</p><p></p><h2><b>Duties and Responsibilities</b></h2><ul><li>Working in a team of highly skilled software and cross functional engineers responsible for delivering software solutions that enables the ever-increasing miniaturization of semiconductor technology.</li><li>Develop software using C&#43;&#43;.</li><li>Create designs and Implement code that is modular, scalable, robust and meet customer requirements.</li><li>Perform unit testing and on target testing to ensure the software meets the high-quality standards our customers expect.</li><li>Evaluation of technical issues, risks, and dependencies for projects.</li><li>Interfacing with stakeholders to gather a complete understanding of their requirements.</li><li>Verify stability, interoperability, portability, security, or scalability of system architecture.</li><li>You will also participate in continuous process improvement activities aimed at ensuring the processes and tools used throughout software development lifecycle are increasing the team’s ability to develop high quality software in the most efficient manner.</li><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Education and Experience</b></h2><ul><li>Requires minimum of BS in Computer Science, or other related engineering or science fields.\xa0\xa0MS a plus.</li><li>Must possess 9 \xa0years of embedded software development experience.</li></ul><h2></h2><h2><b>Skills</b></h2><ul><li>C&#43;&#43; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch. Occasionally required to move around the campus.</li><li>Occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.</li><li>Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.</li></ul><ul><li>Must be willing to work in a clean room environment, wearing coveralls, hoods, booties, safety glasses and gloves for entire duration of shift.</li><li>While performing the duties of this job, the employee routinely is required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch.</li></ul><p></p><p>EOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability</p><p><i>Potential candidates will meet the education and experience requirements provided on the above job description and excel in completing the listed responsibilities for this role.\xa0\xa0 All candidates receiving an offer of employment must successfully complete a background check band any other tests that may be required.\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0</i></p><p>All new ASML jobs have a minimum application deadline of 10 days.</p><p><i>\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 </i></p><h2>#LI-MO1</h2><p></p><p></p><p></p><p>The current base annual salary range for this role is currently:</p>$141,750-236,250<p>Pay scales are determined by role, level, location and alignment with market data. The lead engineer is the technical specialist who determines the solution direction for failing parts, and define a repair strategy.</p><p></p><p></p><p><i>This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in\xa0Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><p>As a Mechatronics New Product Introduction (NPI) Engineer within Development &amp; Engineering, you will be operating in a fast paced and multidisciplinary development environment.\xa0 Using a combination of technical and personal skills, the NPI engineers develops and maintains a relationship with our suppliers to drive the industrialization efforts of the manufacturing process of mechanical components and parts. This individual works closely with the suppliers and ASML cross-sector development teams to optimize the effectiveness and efficiency of the product generation process, in alignment with the ASML project.\xa0 The main goal of this cross sector activity is to secure an excellent quality of parts delivered by our suppliers.</p><p></p><p><b>Roles and responsibilities </b></p><p>Within the D&amp;E organization, the Mechatronics NPI engineer is the primary person responsible for creating an optimal engineering collaboration between the mechanical suppliers and ASML, starting from early supplier involvement through product design and maturity. and external contractors, to mitigate risk, maintain business continuity, and ensure a safe working environment.</p><p><br /><br /><b>Key stakeholders include:</b><br /><br />• Business Partnership commissioning)<br />• Real Estate Development &amp; Strategy (REDS)<br />• Environmental Health and Safety (EHS)<br />• External consultants and contractors<br />• Procurement, Finance, and regulatory bodies<br /><br /><b>Job Description</b></p><ul><li><b>Lead complex, technically challenging projects</b> including large capacity expansion, cleanroom upgrades (semiconductor or pharmaceutical), utilities system installations, and site development in space-constrained environments.</li><li><b>Manage the construction and renovation of facilities systems</b> critical to manufacturing operations, such as HVAC, electrical systems, cleanrooms, and central utilities buildings.</li><li><b>Ensure seamless operation during construction</b> by developing equipment transfer paths through active factory spaces with minimal disruption to ongoing production.</li><li><b>Address civil and structural project needs</b>, including large-scale site development tasks like rock removal and navigating space limitations to optimize site usage.</li><li><b>Collaborate with cross-functional departments</b> such as Business Partnership, Facilities &amp; Maintenance, REDS, EHS, and Procurement to ensure alignment with business needs, project goals, and regulatory compliance.</li><li><b>Support project execution in high-tech environments</b> (semiconductor, pharmaceutical) with a strong focus on cleanroom construction and adherence to stringent industry standards.</li><li><b>Ensure project compliance with safety and environmental standards</b>, including EHS regulations, throughout the project lifecycle.</li><li><b>Manage project financials</b>, including budgeting, tracking, reporting, and forecasting, ensuring alignment with ASML’s financial policies and objectives.</li><li><b>Oversee project scope, quality standards, and progress</b>, providing detailed and timely updates to stakeholders at all levels.</li><li><b>Select and manage contractors, consultants, and vendors</b> to ensure optimal resource allocation and project delivery.</li><li><b>Contribute to the continuous improvement of the BGP process</b>, incorporating lessons learned to refine project execution strategies and processes.</li></ul><p><br /><b>Education and experience</b><br />\xa0</p><ul><li>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Technical Business Administration, Facilities Management, MEP Engineering, or related technical field.</li><li>Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is preferred.</li><li><b>Minimum of 8&#43; years of relevant experience</b>, with a focus on managing large-scale construction, renovation, and technical infrastructure projects within high-tech manufacturing environments (preferably semiconductor or pharmaceutical).</li><li>Proven experience in <b>cleanroom construction</b>, and handling complex infrastructure systems such as HVAC, electrical, plumbing, and utility systems for manufacturing sites.</li><li>Strong understanding of <b>civil, structural, and site development</b>, including site planning, rock removal, and maximizing limited space.</li><li><b>Technical knowledge of facilities systems</b> and services, including utilities management, and integration with manufacturing processes.</li><li>Experience managing <b>multidisciplinary teams</b> and external contractors to execute complex projects on tight schedules and budgets.</li><li>Familiarity with project management tools such as <b>MS Project</b> and <b>PMIS</b> for tracking and reporting progress.</li><li>Knowledge of <b>LEAN methodologies</b>, <b>PMBoK</b>, and <b>Prince2</b> is advantageous.</li></ul><p><br /><b>Key Competencies</b><br />\xa0</p><ul><li>Strong <b>technical acumen</b> with the ability to make regulations throughout the project lifecycle.</li></ul><p><br /><b>Context of the position</b><br />The Senior Project Manager will oversee critical facilities projects as part of ASML’s Corporate Real Estate team. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Every day, multiple DoAs are reported, impacting ASML’s customers. For ASML and its customers, it is critical to find the root causes and prevent reoccurrences. The Tool DoA engineer has a key role in ASMLs drive to reduce DOAs and improve quality!</p><p>We’re looking for a creative &amp; resourceful engineer to join our team and help us turn DoA issues into pragmatic solutions. If you thrive on solving puzzles, collaborating with talented minds, and making a real impact, we want to hear from you! We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Mechanical Engineer to support the operation, maintenance, and optimization of our facilities infrastructure. This role is critical to ensuring the reliability, efficiency, and safety of our complex mechanical systems, which enable the success of our manufacturing operations.</p><p>The Facilities Commissioning Engineer ensures the successful startup, validation, and optimization of facility systems, equipment, and infrastructure. This role provides technical expertise in mechanical and building systems, including HVAC, piping, process utilities, and supporting infrastructure. The Commissioning Engineer is responsible for developing and executing commissioning plans, troubleshooting installation issues, and ensuring that all systems meet design specifications, operational requirements, and compliance standards.</p><h2><b>Role and responsibilities</b></h2><p><b>Commissioning &amp; System Validation:</b></p><ul><li>Develop and execute <b>commissioning plans</b> for new and modified mechanical, electrical, and process utility systems.</li><li>Verify that installed equipment and systems meet <b>design intent, operational specifications, and compliance standards</b>.</li><li>Conduct <b>functional performance tests (FPTs), system integration tests (SITs), and reliability trials</b>.</li><li>Identify, document, and troubleshoot <b>installation, performance, and operational issues</b>.</li></ul><p><b>Equipment Installation &amp; Facility Startups:</b></p><ul><li>Provide oversight during <b>equipment installations</b>, ensuring proper alignment, piping, controls, and performance.</li><li>Support the transition from construction to operations, ensuring systems are fully validated before handover.</li><li>Ensure adherence to <b>ISO, ASHRAE, SMACNA, and corporate engineering standards</b> for all installations.</li></ul><p><b>Project Engineering &amp; Documentation:</b></p><ul><li>Review <b>engineering drawings, specifications, and submittals</b> to validate system designs before commissioning.</li><li>Develop detailed <b>method of procedures (MOPs)</b> for commissioning, decommissioning, and operational validation.</li><li>Maintain thorough documentation, including commissioning reports, punch lists, and test records.</li><li>Track issues to resolution, coordinating with vendors, contractors, and internal teams to ensure timely corrective actions.</li></ul><p><b>Collaboration &amp; Issue Resolution:</b> Identify and resolve commissioning issues <b>within defined project timelines</b>.</li><li><b>Safety &amp; Compliance:</b> Maintain <b>100% compliance</b> with regulatory, corporate, and industry standards.</li></ul><h2><b>Education and experience</b></h2><ul><li><b>Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering</b> (or other relevant engineering discipline).</li><li><b>10&#43; Do you understand how to influence a design to avoid unnecessary production disruption and improve serviceability? Then the Manufacturing and Equipment Engineer for Tooling position might be the opportunity for you!<br />\xa0</p><h2>Roles and responsibilities </h2><p>The D&amp;E\xa0Mechatronic &amp; Measurement Systems Development (MMS) department provides cutting edge mechatronics solutions for ASML products. MMS specifies designs and trade-off technical solutions and predictably and integrates, industrializes and delivers mechatronic subsystems that meet business requirements.\xa0\xa0This job, within the MMS Mechatronics APPS department, you \xa0provide all means needed for the industrialization of all MMS Functions and the Platform.\xa0\xa0</p><p></p><p>As Manufacturing and Equipment Engineer, your mission is to optimize the reliability, availability, serviceability, and cycle time of precision manufacturing equipment as it moves from the early development phase to operations at our factory in Taiwan and international customer sites. You make sure that all work instructions, diagnostics, tools, trainings and spare parts are available for the manufacturing and customer-support operational sectors.\xa0You are the interface between the Development Projects and Manufacturing/ Customer support.\xa0You will guard the industrialization aspects in early KD phases, support proto and pilot production (Work preparation, troubleshooting, knowledge transfers) and transfer the industrialization deliverables toward Manufacturing and Customer support.</p><ul><li>Work in multidisciplinary project teams, aimed at design of a mechatronics module or function/platform support\xa0</li><li>New product introduction to factory and field, <b>support the</b> analysis of complex problems on-site.\xa0</li><li>Provide the industrialization deliverables (assembly, test and service sequences and procedures, diagnostics, out of control action plans, tooling, spare parts, training documentation,\xa0etc) towards the operational sectors.\xa0\xa0</li><li>Close the feedback loop by providing operational feedback (Reliability, Availability,\xa0 Manufacturability, Serviceability) to the projects and functions within MSD.\xa0</li><li>Active contribution to the definition of the project (KD7) concerning industrialization.\xa0</li><li>Knowledge transfer to local service organizations (KT&#39;s documentation &#43; Training on the job).\xa0</li><li>If needed travel to solve complex problems on site (international travel max 10%).</li><li>Actively participate/own the escalation from the field teams, working closely with Development and Customer Support.</li><li>Participate in cross sectoral meetings and be the link between Manufacturing, Customer Support and Development organization.\xa0</li></ul><h2><br />Education and experience</h2><p>You hold a bachelor- or master’s degree in mechanical engineering, applied physics, mechatronics or electrical engineering (or a similar field). \xa0</p><p></p><p>You have a minimum of 5 years of experience in a machine-building industry preferably including:\xa0\xa0</p><ul><li>Experience in a production environment with semiconductor high tech products and complex production and service processes.\xa0</li><li>Troubleshooting complex mechatronic systems\xa0</li><li>Experience in the field of Manufacturing and or Service Engineering or mechanics.</li><li>Creating documentation and trainings with attention to the details.</li><li>Ability to have broad discussions with designers of the mechatronic modules and influence without have to power to detail the design</li><li>Optional: supplier quality engineering experience</li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Skills</b></h2><p>Working at the cutting edge of tech, you will always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way do that. You will not work in a silo. Instead, you will be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you will collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You will have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.</p><p></p><p>To thrive in this job, you will need the following skills:</p><ul><li>You are interested in product and process and have a strong technical background with analytical skills.</li><li>You are fluent in English, with strong communication skills.</li><li>You have a get-on and do it mentality, you take the initiative.</li><li>You are focused on quality and strive for continuous improvement.</li><li>You are a team player and have good social skills.<br />\xa0</li></ul><h2>Other information</h2><p>Within ASML, the sector D&amp;E is responsible for the specification, design and engineering, integration and qualification of the ASML products. The Mechatronics APPS department is end-to-end responsible for providing mechatronics and platform (architecture) solutions for eScan systems. Focusing on cost of good, Cost to complete, serviceability, manufacturability and early supplier involvement.</p><ul></ul><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p><i>This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the</i> <i>United States</i> <i>Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.</i></p><p></p><h2><b>Diversity and inclusion</b></h2><p>ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><h2><b>Duties and Responsibilities</b></h2><p>This role is responsible for the planning and coordination of on time, high quality, software deliveries from DUV Light source Software teams.</p><ul><li>Manage requirement intake process.</li><li>Work with\xa0 other PLs driving software receivables and deliverables.</li><li>Responsible for end-to-end delivery of software infrastructure &amp; platform projects.</li><li>Responsible for release delivery to System Integration.</li><li>Responsible for driving software escalation, triage, and disposition.</li></ul><ul><li>Provide the project management interface between software development projects and critical stakeholders (System Integration, Program, Functions) for efficient coordination, execution of critical activities.</li><li>Creates and track software receivables and deliverables, driving on time quality releases.</li><li>Assesses and highlights risks and develops mitigation plans.</li><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Education and Experience</b></h2><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Physics, or Electrical Engineering.</li><li>Must have 8 years of technical project management experience.</li><li>Software project management experience preferred.</li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Skills</b></h2><ul><li>Ability to drive projects ensuring timeline and quality commitments are met.</li><li>An effective communicator with experience presenting to both business stakeholders and technical staff. Able to communicate technical concepts through written and/or graphical formats.</li><li>A skilled negotiator who can balance competing requests from different stakeholders.</li><li>A good knowledge of software engineering principles.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills with the ability to influence, motivate, and mentor.</li><li>Excellent customer service skills and stakeholder management, with an advanced understanding of internal and external customer relationship building.</li><li>Ability to adapt processes to improve inefficiencies and accelerate product development.</li><li>Excellent decision making skills and business judgment.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Other Information</b></p><ul><li>This position is located on-site in San Diego, CA .\xa0 It requires onsite presence to attend in-person work-related events, trainings and meetings and to further ensure teamwork, collaboration and innovation.</li></ul><ul><li>A flexible workplace arrangement may be available to employees working in roles conducive to remote work (up to two days a week).</li><li>Routinely required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch. Competences found in the train include Optics, Sensor Design, Electronics, SW, MDEV, Industrialization, Testing and Integration. There are 10 executional teams of which each has a PO or TL. CPO is responsible for the planning, execution, and reporting of the train deliverables (HW, functionality, CPDs), overseeing all the teams and POs’ performances. The train cockpit consists of FO, CPO, RTE and FCA. Our train is characterized by a complex and extensive stakeholder landscape - as our deliverables have a direct impact on EUV system performance, we collaborate continually with EUV Source and Scanner’s neighboring functions.</p><p></p><h2><b>DC’s Chief Product Owner (CPO)</b></h2><p>DC CPO reside in the functional group that consists of senior project leaders, architects, design engineers and integrators, working seamlessly with DC SW, IE, and Edev teams.</p><p></p><p>The CPO is responsible to bring the functional roadmap to realization within our triple constraints by means of strategic and tactical planning. To do this, the CPO must align with and create buy-in from senior stakeholders (PLs, PCM’s, GLs, DMs). The CPO guides the train to maximize value creation and ensures that the train’s long-term plan matches product master plans at both NXE and EXE BLs. The CPO has a pivotal leadership position in the train and towards the POs in particular (dash line report to CPO). As such, the CPO needs to bring the train and stakeholders along in the constant priorities balancing act between constraints, stability, customer demand, ASML business needs, innovation and sustaining the product life cycle, so every party understands how the train contributes to ASML and why decisions are taken. The CPO understands products, processes and business context of the train portfolio. She/he speaks both business and technical language to translate customer and business needs into team objectives.</p><p></p><p>To be able to execute this role, four core competences are key:</p><ul><li><p>Lead through vision and business sense. CPO applies guardrails to balance demand over team capacity and competence. Speaks both business and technical language. Collaborates closely with PO&#39;s and other CPO&#39;s</p></li><li><p>Collaborate with stakeholders and train. As Senior PMO, you pro-actively assist the QBPI Program Management team to optimize business value by:</p><ul><li><p>Providing support in structuring strategy initiatives into an overall planning structure, scheduling framework</p></li><li><p>Setting-up, arranging training materials and facilitating workshops to train stakeholders in our scheduling processes</p></li><li><p>Creating what is needed, not necessarily what is being asked</p></li><li><p>Driving\xa0effective decision making on all levels (challenging the triple constraint), including accurate reporting &amp; metrics</p></li><li><p>Define and drive the critical path analysis</p></li><li><p>Driving effective communication and/or escalations on the issues/risks and the required contingency/mitigation actions to the stakeholders;</p></li><li><p>Providing input and advice during the portfolio rebalancing process</p></li><li><p>When needed to be able to roll up data, analyze data, report and distil key information on milestones and deliverables, planning, actuals and delays, be able to challenge and advise</p></li><li><p>Contribute to the knowledge build-up of the department PMO. Current focus is to setup the scheduling framework within the program with specific initiative focus. This role will be extended by making this the standard for all QBPI Initiatives</p></li><li><p>Leading and executing initiatives to increase the BPI Program maturity with special focus on program management tooling and processes, towards integration of program planning</p></li></ul><p></p><h2>Education and experience</h2><ul><li><p>Bachelor or Master degree, preferably in Business Engineering or Technical Business Administration</p></li><li><p>Minimum of 5 years working experience as a hands-on PMO officer for complex programs and projects in a dynamic and innovative (high-tech) organization</p></li><li><p>Expert knowledge in the area of scheduling, setting up scheduling frameworks, implementing ways of working and processes in the area of program and project scheduling is a must</p></li><li><p>Comfortable working with the following tools is a must: Microsoft Project Online, Excel (e.g. pivot tables, Power Query and potentially Power BI)</p></li></ul><p></p><ul><li><p>Certified in Prince2, IPMA-D, IPMA PMO, PM-Bok or similar and/or Lean/Agile methodology is a plus</p></li><li><p>Ability to work with Spotfire (TIBCO) is a plus</p></li><li><p>Please don&#39;t forget to include a motivation letter when applying for this role</p></li></ul><h2></h2><p></p><h2>Skills</h2><p>Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in\xa0Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><p>Founded in 1984, ASML is the world’s leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or microchips. The mission of the Mechanical Development department is to design and develop the complex mechanics for these machines, which are some of the highest precision products ever produced in the world. This position is based on-site in Wilton, CT, which has both R&amp;D and manufacturing operations. We design and produce multiple sub-system modules that are shipped to our headquarters in Veldhoven, The Netherlands where they are integrated into the full lithography machine.</p><p></p><p><b>Role and Responsibilities</b></p><p>As a Principal Mechanical Analysis Architect, you will</p><ul><li>Provide high level technical leadership to 3-8 project architects and/or co-developers responsible for the development of portions of the lithography system and/or associated tooling</li><li>Work on modules and sub-systems involving robotics, mechatronics, precision mechanics, and/or opto-mechanics</li><li>Need to consider kinematics, dynamics, material properties and structural, dynamic and thermal analysis</li><li>Own the mechanical roadmap for a sub-system (function) within ASML’s lithography machine and/or other ASML equipment</li><li>Collaborate with the ASML Functional Architects and System Engineers to create and maintain this roadmap</li><li>Explore new technologies and investigate feasibility of alternative mechanical architectures for ASML’s next generation products</li><li>Be responsible for understanding the functional requirements and supporting project architects as they derive relevant specifications</li><li>Provide the technical leadership and engineering foundation to produce high quality mechanical product designs that meet module-level mechanical specifications and volume constraints, negotiated as needed with the Functional Cluster or Module Architect</li><li>Ensure the design is optimized for trouble-free product life-cycle within the ASML design release, procurement, manufacturing, transportation, operation and customer service environments and is achievable within schedule and cost constraints, negotiated as needed with the Project Leader</li><li>Collaborate on-site with other Senior Architects, Lead Architects, Project Architects, Team Leads, Project Leads, Design Engineers and project team members</li><li>Some travel (up to 10%) within the US and internationally can be expected</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Education and Experience</b></p><p>To help us tackle the technical challenges we face, you will need experience years of experience with complex or precision mechanical design</li><li>Strong background in mechanical design and engineering, including taking responsibility of the full “art to part” development cycle</li><li>A background in mechanical design of mechatronics, precision design, or complex optical systems is desirable</li><li>Good complex mechanical system intuition</li></ul><ul><li>Mechanical design exposure to kinematics, dynamics, material properties and behavior and structural analysis</li><li>Genuine interest in developing precision systems that can perform reliably at customer sites</li><li>Solid working knowledge of mechanical analytical techniques, including “first principle” engineering equations and Finite Element Analysis (e.g. stress, strain, deformation, modal response, etc.)</li><li>Ability to perform to structural, thermal, fluid and dynamics fundamentals and calculations</li><li>Knowledge/hands-on experience with software/technical tools (e.g. CAD modeling, FEM, mathematical tools, etc.)</li><li>Demonstrated ability to derive conclusions from analysis and make practical recommendations</li><li>Able to negotiate system-level requirements and {'company': 'ASML', 'job_id': 'J-00315463', 'title': 'Principal Mechanical Analysis Engineer', 'department': ['Design Engineering and Architecture'], 'location': 'Wilton, US', 'degree': ['Bachelor', 'Master', 'PhD'], 'experience_level': ['See job description'], 'description': '<p><b>Introduction to the Job</b></p><p>ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in\xa0Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><p>Founded in 1984, ASML is the world’s leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or microchips. The mission of the Mechanical Development department is to design and develop the complex mechanics for these machines, which are some of the highest precision products ever produced in the world. This position is based on-site in Wilton, CT, which has both R&amp;D and manufacturing operations. We design and produce multiple sub-system modules that are shipped to our headquarters in Veldhoven, The Netherlands where they are integrated into the full lithography machine.</p><p></p><p><b>Role and Responsibilities</b></p><p>As a Principal Mechanical Analysis Engineer, you will</p><ul><li>Be responsible for developing portions of the lithography system and/or associated tooling</li><li>Work on sub-systems involving robotics, mechatronics, precision mechanics, and/or optomechanics</li><li>Understand the functional requirements and deriving specifications for precision machine design at ASML</li><li>Collaborate with system architects in a multidiscipline project team to develop concepts, perform engineering analysis, build and test prototypes, generate detailed CAD designs, create engineering drawings, partner with suppliers and support system integration and testing</li><li>Some travel (up to 10%) within the US and internationally can be expected</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Education and Experience</b></p><p>To help us tackle the technical challenges we face, you will need experience working on high-tech products and with complex processes.</p><p></p><p>As Principal Mechanical Analysis Engineer, you will need:</p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or other engineering, math or science degree and 10&#43; years of experience with complex or precision mechanical design</li></ul><p>OR</p><ul><li>Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or other engineering, math or science degree and 7&#43; years of experience with complex or precision mechanical design</li></ul><p>OR</p><ul><li>PhD in Mechanical Engineering or other engineering, math or science degree</li><li>Strong background in mechanical design and engineering, including taking responsibility of the full “art to part” development cycle</li><li>A background in mechanical design of mechatronics, precision design, or complex optical systems is desirable</li><li>Good complex mechanical system intuition</li></ul><ul><li>Mechanical design exposure to kinematics, dynamics, material properties and behavior and structural analysis</li><li>Experience with 3D solid modelling for design conceptualization and realization</li><li>Basic experience with mechanical analytical techniques, including “first principle” engineering equations and Finite Element Analysis (e.g. stress, strain, deformation, modal response, etc.)</li><li>Demonstrated ability to derive conclusions from analysis and make practical recommendations</li><li>Strong technical writing, communication and presentations skills</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Skills</b></p><p>Working at the cutting edge of tech, you will always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way do that. The engineer will work closely with internal teams, contractors, and suppliers to develop and maintain robust electrical infrastructure, ensuring compliance with industry standards and business continuity.</p><p></p><p><b>Vision:</b></p><p>To provide reliable, efficient, and safe electrical infrastructure that supports uninterrupted operations and future growth.</p><p><b>Mission:</b></p><p>Deliver expert electrical engineering solutions to maintain and enhance facility power systems, optimize energy use, and ensure seamless integration of new technologies while prioritizing safety and sustainability.</p><p><b>Core Values:</b></p><ul><li><b>Safety &amp; Locally sited Customer Support branches perform these tasks for the customers within the specific region.</p><p></p><p><b>Role and responsibilities</b></p><ul><li><p>Understands complex modules at platform level, complex system at platform level, or complex business drivers at system level; masters multiple competencies; is able to translate (internal) customer requirements into product capabilities and options regarding all competencies (imaging/overlay/productivity/metrology); suggests product improvements to prevent process errors from recurring.</p></li><li><p>Develops and maintains a network across several functional areas, to be able to drive solutions for structural problems within all competencies; deals with (internal) customers.</p></li><li><p>Within tight timelines and with scarce resources, figure out what needs to be done in specific, dynamic situations using own professional judgment and dealing with complex upgrades that take 1-2 weeks to implement at (internal) customer site; solve situations which are difficult but have occurred before, minimizes impact on (internal) customer’s work in progress regarding a competency and adjacent options.</p></li><li><p>For complex upgrades that take 3-9 weeks to implement at (internal) customer site; needs to solve problems that have not occurred before, minimizes impact on (internal) customer’s work in progress regarding all lithographic production steps.</p></li><li><p>Works unsupervised with high-level checks with superior.</p></li><li><p>Identifies gaps and drives solution, ensures processes are adapted to prevent (work) process errors from recurring and identifies missing processes/procedures and develops them.</p></li><li><p>Assesses skill levels and grows new hires. The sector Customer Support (CS) is responsible for the maintenance, repair and continuous improvement of ASML systems at customer locations and supporting the customers in the use of these systems in their production process.</p></li><li><p>CS Central enables effective support of the customer by providing technical knowledge and process support to the field offices. EUV engineering is part of New Product Introduction and Node Transition segment in the CS.</p></li><li><p>Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.</p></li></ul><p></p><p>This position will report directly to the Department Manager for CS in Wilton.</p><p></p><p><b>Education and experience</b></p><ul><li><p>Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in engineering, or combination of experience and education may be considered.</p></li><li><p>Preferably 8&#43; years, or more, work experience in an engineering or customer support role.</p></li><li><p>Direct knowledge stepper/scanner related experience in the semi-conductor or related experience is a plus.</p></li><li><p>Direct knowledge of EUV systems is a plus.</p></li><li><p>Excellent verbal and writing skills in English.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Skills</b></p><p></p><p>Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. Local site Customer Support branches perform these tasks for the customer within the specific region.<br />The Field Service Engineer 2 executes regular and irregular maintenance activities with considerable independency and under limited supervision. Handles defined and regular problems/maintanance on a machine, either independently or through escalation without supervision.</p><p></p><h2><b><b>Requirements</b></b></h2><p>Experienced Field Service Enginer with BSc degree in relevant Technical Field (Electrical Technology, Mechatronics, Mechanical Engineering, etc.) or equivalent experience.<br />Experienced in technical industry is required and/or semiconductor industry experience prefered.<br />Experience in using computer applications, including data analysis tools, spreadsheet, and presentation software.<br />Has complete knowledge on product functionality of the main modules/sub-modules.</p><p></p><h2><b><b>Responsibilities</b></b></h2><p></p><h3><b>Problem analysis and approach</b></h3><p>Gather all information relevant for the problem, analyze using available means, gather additional diagnostic info if needed, decide on initial approach to solve problem and execute, consult with others.</p><p></p><h3><b>Problem handovers and routing</b></h3><p>Handover problem or problem aspects to others (2nd line support), document and package all data relevant for problem resolution (e.g. pass-downs, work orders, field service reports, system problem reports, technical reports).</p><p></p><h3><b>Repairs</b></h3><p>Use tools, replace parts, improve settings, to execute repairs and standard service actions independently.</p><p></p><h3><b>Procedures</b></h3><p>Based on arranged customer machine time window to arrange for all (possible) parts, tools, equipment and information / knowledge to be available Do you get energy from solving complex planning puzzles? Are you capable of managing a diverse and senior stakeholder field? Then we have an excellent opportunity for you in the ASML Planning &amp; Delivery department!</p><p>Role and responsibilities</p><p></p><p>As Business Planner, you set the stable &amp; reliable plan for materials supplied by external parties and internal factories, enabling our supply chain to deliver, while balancing availability and inventory in line with business objectives. You are the orchestrator of the ASML supply chain, ensuring material availability for our factories and our customers. You understand and clarify demand dynamics towards your supplying parties, supporting your counterparts to meet the ASML growth path.</p><p></p><p>Further, you are responsible for:</p><ul><li><p>Securing material availability to secure system output and service events at our customers:</p></li><li><p>Providing a stable and reliable plan to our suppliers and module factories</p></li><li><p>Creating Demand &amp; Supply (D&amp;S) overviews for materials (0-24 month horizon)</p></li><li><p>Driving D&amp;S gap closure actions and monitoring plan execution on a weekly basis</p></li><li><p>Driving decision-making on investment scenarios for capacity increases (1-3 year horizon)</p></li><li><p>Managing inventory levels to reduce the risk of excess &amp; obsolescence (E&amp;O):</p></li><li><p>Taking decision on buffer strategies</p></li><li><p>Making inventory projections and E&amp;O risk assessments</p></li><li><p>Actively resolving inefficient and over planned inventory risks</p></li><li><p>Deploying planning signals by</p></li><li><p>Optimizing planning parameters</p></li><li><p>Deciding on and implementing best planning policy (eg manual planning versus MRP)</p></li><li><p>Improving planning policies and methodologies (eg new demand leveling method)</p></li><li><p>Driving continuous improvement</p></li><li><p>Collaborating closely with demand planning departments, supplier-facing departments, product lifecycle management and production planning to reach agreement on the supply plan and D&amp;S gap closure action.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Education </b></p><ul><li><p>Relevant Master or advanced degree (e.g., Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering or Business Administration).</p></li></ul><p><b>Experience</b></p><ul><li><p>Good understanding of and experience with supply chain management processes, with focus on supply/ material planning</p></li><li><p>Experience with S&amp;OP as well as Master Production Schedule and Production Planning</p></li><li><p>Relevant experience with SAP software solutions such as SAP ERP, SAP IBP, SAP APO and SAP HANA</p></li><li><p>Experience in setting-up and leading projects successfully</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Personal skills</b></p><p>Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems. P&amp;D collaborates closely with business lines and sectors to connect requirements and priorities into an integrated business plan, while remaining clear on bottlenecks and real constraints, so we can stretch them to meet opportunities without becoming unrealistic. Ensuring customer quality complaints are investigated for preventive actions.\xa0\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Participates in audits, addressing customer concerns, and ensuring adherence to established quality protocols.\xa0\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Works closely with other departments to address customer needs, and plays a role in improving overall customer satisfaction.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Utilizes advanced negotiation and communication skills to exceed customer expectations and enhance satisfaction.\xa0</p></li></ul><p><u>Culture &amp; Community</u>\xa0</p><ul><li><p>Live the Living Quality &amp; Excellence culture by enabling employees to own quality and creating a safe environment where employees can speak-up on Q&amp;E topics.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Actively promote/use of the Q&amp;E Reward &amp; Recognition program and Q&amp;E Communication Strategy.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Be an active member within the Q&amp;E Community and related events and act as a role model within the sector/region\xa0</p></li></ul><p><u>Stakeholder Management</u>\xa0</p><ul><li><p>Builds and maintains a network of internal and external stakeholders and represents the organization on operational and/or technical topics.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Stakeholders are typically other (senior) experts and or (senior) Line Managers (typically JG11/12) of own and interfacing departments.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Communicates with and influences internal and external parties beyond content-driven arguments. Frequently reflects on stakeholder feedback to drive a continuously improving organization.\xa0</p></li></ul><p><u>Strategy &amp; Policy</u>\xa0</p><ul><li><p>Executes the key elements of the functional strategy through specialist expertise and insights, to ensure that the strategy meets business needs.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Executes and contributes to policies, procedures, and related guidelines within the Q&amp;E expertise to meet defined key principles and ensure compliance with external requirements.\xa0</p></li></ul><p><u>Business Planning</u>\xa0</p><ul><li><p>Develops and proposes annual business plans/roadmaps for a given area, department or supplier, ensuring alignment with the strategy.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Translates strategic and operational targets into plans\u200b with 1-2 year horizon and is responsible for the realization of the plans within timing and budget constraints.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Manages and acquires approval for planned deviations.\xa0</p></li></ul><p>\xa0</p><p>\u202f\xa0</p><p><b>Education\u202fand Experience</b>\xa0</p><ul><li><p>Bachelors degree required. The Corporate Real Estate (CRE) organization is a centralized department that is responsible for CRE activities worldwide, serving &gt;40,000 employees.</p><p></p><p>Within CRE – Netherlands the Asset Management department takes control of CRE’s hard services mostly situated in Veldhoven and cover various disciplines like mechanical, electrical, civil &amp; architectural, smart building solutions and process utilities. With a mission to secure ASML’s business continuity now and in the future.</p><p></p><p>The Asset Management Specialists are part of the CRE-NL Strategic Asset Management team that supports the three teams other team withing CRE-NL Asset Management: the Tactical &amp; Operational Asset Management team, the Commissioning &amp; Acceptance team and the Asset Competence team.</p><p></p><p>You are surrounded with managers and specialists in the field of asset data &amp; AMS, contract &amp; supplier management, asset performance, long term asset maintenance planning, business continuity &amp; risk, shutdown &amp; turnaround, inventory &amp; storage solutions, business analist, quality &amp; compliance and improvement, commissioning &amp; acceptance, competence (engineering) and innovation.</p><p></p><p>You work closely with CRE’s Centre of Excellence to align on CRE’s Asset Management.</p><p>Mission, vision &amp; policy, global standards, applications and processes. Balancing global coherence with local efficiency and practicality.\xa0</p><p></p><h2><b>Role and responsibilities </b></h2><p>As Asset Management Specialists you are the link between all asset management related specialists and activities. Providing the “helicopter view’ and overseeing ‘the bigger picture’ of asset management.</p><p></p><p>You will take the lead in connecting peers and related specialists to align, improve and excel. One of your main tools are the (standard) asset management processes. You support the teams in creating, using and maintaining efficient asset management processes, and ensure seamless connections between them.</p><p></p><p>You will act as sparring partner and back up for direct colleagues. Being a generalist you act as a sparring partner and back-up, for most direct colleagues and are involved in changes within all fields of asset management.</p><p></p><p>One of your responsibilities is securing the strategic framework, tactical focus and organization and operational design of all asset management related activities for CRE cope in the Netherlands.</p><p></p><p>You design and maintain asset master data (like libraries) and set the requirements for the asset management system(s) and the data needed for high level asset management.</p><p></p><p>To secure ASML’s growth on the long run you create and manage a priority model to be used for decision making on maintenance and investment. You understand the importance of collaboration across departments, acting as a role model while encouraging your team. You share knowledge/information and are able to create an environment where people feel safe to express their views openly. You motivate team members to work towards both operational and team goals. You credit others for their contributions and accomplishment and of course you celebrate team successes along the way.\xa0Project and year planning support: Involved in assigned projects. Acquire overall knowledge of the department year plan, activities, projects and daily priorities in order to ensure smooth information and work flow.</p><p></p><p><b>Role and responsibilities</b></p><p>As a Senior Management Assistant, you manage and take ownership of your work while demonstrating a strong drive to achieve meaningful results and show determination in the face of obstacles. You will pro-actively search for ways to improve customer service and independently manage expectations and meet the (future) needs of the manager. By taking a helicopter view you are able to signal process improvement opportunities and will continuously seek for new ways of working in our fast-changing environment. In summary, as a Senior Management Assistant we expect you to:</p><ul><li><p>Seek for opportunities to optimize the daily work for your team and general processes.</p></li><li><p>Pro-actively share information and provide feedback to others.</p></li><li><p>Be a senior role model for the rest of your team by stimulatingly a feedback culture with open communication.</p></li><li><p>Promote MST and support your team lead, building a strong and reliable support organization.</p></li><li><p>Be a teambuilder and understand the importance of sharing knowledge.</p></li><li><p>Work consciously to bring MST to a higher level.</p></li></ul><p><b>The tasks of the Senior Management Assistant include:</b></p><ul><li><p>International calendar &amp; meeting management: Effectively and efficiently manage (own) the agenda of your managers. {'company': 'ASML', 'job_id': 'J-00314609', 'title': 'Metrology Engineer - Production First Line Support (CWW Night)', 'department': ['Design Engineering and Architecture'], 'location': 'Wilton, US', 'degree': ['Bachelor', 'Master'], 'experience_level': ['0-1 year', '2-3 years', '4-9 years', '10-15 years'], 'description': '<p><b>Who are we ? </b></p><p></p><p>ASML US, LP brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers – to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Wilton, CT, Chandler, AZ and San Jose, CA.</p><p></p><p><b>Job Mission</b></p><p></p><p>ASML is the world’s leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or microchips. This position is for a First Line Support Production Engineer to work in the Production Engineering department in Wilton Factory, CT. The candidate will work with cross-sector employees &amp; teams to provide rapid responses to resolve engineering\xa0disturbance notices related. In addition, the candidate will perform engineering steps listed in the production operator dashboard (POD) to support output.</p><p></p><p></p><p><b>Schedule</b></p><p></p><p>Work Schedule : Compressed Work Week Nights 1 (CWW N1) schedule that works from 6pm to 6am on Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, and every other Wednesday <u>OR</u> Compressed Work Week Nights 2 (CWW N2) schedule that works from 6pm to 6am on Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and every other Wednesday.</p><p></p><p><b>Job Description</b></p><ul><li><p>Spend about 75% of time in the Cleanroom providing direct support to production processes and troubleshooting</p></li><li><p>Troubleshoot metrology issues in a timely &amp; efficient manner.</p></li><li><p>Troubleshoot module test and final qual issues in a timely &amp; efficient manner.</p></li><li><p>Troubleshoot manufacturing tooling and optical metrology equipment issues in a timely &amp; efficient manner.</p></li><li><p>Thorough understanding of how to correct optical aberrations</p></li><li><p>Run image processing algorithms to extract nanometer scale flatness information from interferometric data</p></li><li><p>Analyze MATLAB scripts and plot data from existing databases</p></li><li><p>Support image analysis on data and derive conclusions</p></li><li><p>Develop OCAPs, Fishbones and troubleshooting guidelines</p></li><li><p>Support diagnostics qualification and implementation for production staff</p></li><li><p>Evaluate and disposition failed parts with proposed solutions</p></li><li><p>Support development of Manufacturing procedures and technical work instructions</p></li><li><p>Support design and document reviews for diagnostics</p></li><li><p>Support DOA (Dead on Arrival) Root Cause Analysis</p></li><li><p>Support cycle time and labor hours roadmaps implementation</p></li><li><p>Support PFMEA</p></li><li><p>Able to read optical, mechanical and electrical drawings</p></li><li><p>Knowledge of MATLAB, LabVIEW and Python is a plus</p></li><li><p>The employee is required to work in a cleanroom environment:</p><ul><li><p>full gowning (full body coveralls, hood, CR safety shoes, face mask, nitrile gloves and safety glasses. Working under ISO 9000/14000 standards).</p></li><li><p>Working around overhead cranes, fork trucks and motorized pallet movers.</p></li><li><p>Working around lasers; working with ladders; working on platforms; and working around chemicals.</p></li></ul></li></ul><p><br /><b>Education</b></p><ul><li><p>Bachelors Degree in Optics, Photonics, Optical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science and 2-4 years of experience in a technical production environment</p></li><li><p>Masters Degree in Optics, Photonics, Optical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science with experience with applicable internship</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Experience / Requirements</b></p><ul><li><p>Working knowledge of geometric optics, wave optics, Gaussian propagation, and aberration theory, and interferometry</p></li><li><p>Working Knowledge in image/signal/data process algorithm, statistics and software development</p></li><li><p>Working knowledge with optical assembly/alignment/test equipment/tools</p></li><li><p>Working Knowledge in lasers, polarization, detectors, electro-optical devices and opto-mechanical constructions</p></li><li><p>Experience in a production environment with high tech products and complex production processes</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Preferred Requirements </b></p><ul><li><p>Working knowledge with epoxy application in opto-mechanical designs is a plus</p></li><li><p>Working knowledge with Optical-Electrical sensors is a plus</p></li><li><p>Working knowledge of diverse optical metrology setups: Interferometers, Shack – Hartmann sensor, polarimetry/ellipsometry &amp; Optical alignment is a plus</p></li><li><p>Experience in the field of technical Production Engineering and quality methodology such as statistical process control and FMEA is a plus</p></li><li><p>Working knowledge of NX, Teamcenter and SAP is a plus</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Personal skills</b></p><ul><li><p>Capability to interface with multidisciplinary groups (including senior leadership), and be willing to take on responsibility and follow through</p></li><li><p>Possess strong ownership characteristics – demonstrated commitment to achieving results on time</p></li><li><p>Have strong written and oral communicative skills – ability to communicate effectively to your team and to senior management</p></li><li><p>Focus on quality and continuous improvements</p></li><li><p>Demonstrated “team player” with a quality orientation and interpersonal skills</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Additional details </b></p><p></p><p>The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
