We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers – to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Wilton, CT, Chandler, AZ and San Jose, CA.</p><p></p><p>Work Schedule : Compressed Work Week Nights 1 (CWW N1) schedule that works from 6pm to 6am on Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, and every other Wednesday <u>OR</u> Compressed Work Week Nights 2 (CWW N2) schedule that works from 6pm to 6am on Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and every other Wednesday.</p><p></p><p><b>Job Mission</b></p><p>ASML is the world’s leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or microchips. This position is for a First Line Support Production Engineer with innovative attitude to work in the Production Engineering department in Wilton Factory. Candidate will work with cross-sectors employees to provide rapid response to resolve\xa0disturbance notices related to engineering issues and to perform the engineering steps listed in the production operator dashboard (POD) to support output.</p><p></p><p><b>Job Description</b></p><ul><li><p>Spends about 75% of time in the Cleanroom providing direct support to production processes and troubleshooting</p></li><li><p>Provide efficient response to troubleshoot electro-mechanical modules and subassemblies</p></li><li><p>Provide efficient response to troubleshoot module test and final qual issues</p></li><li><p>Provide efficient response to troubleshoot multi-discipline test equipment (Hardware/Software/Electrical/Servo)</p></li><li><p>Master test rig qualification software:\xa0 Linux/Python &#43; Proprietary ASML GUI</p></li><li><p>Analyze MATLAB runs and plot data from database</p></li><li><p>Support query code to interrogate data for manufacturing needs</p></li><li><p>Support analysis on test data and derive conclusions</p></li><li><p>Develop OCAPs, Fishbones and troubleshooting guidelines</p></li><li><p>Support diagnostics qualification and implementation for production staff</p></li><li><p>Evaluate and disposition failed parts with proposed solutions</p></li><li><p>Support development of Manufacturing procedures and technical work instructions</p></li><li><p>Support design and document reviews for diagnostics</p></li><li><p>Support DOA (Dead on Arrival) root cause analysis</p></li><li><p>Support cycle time and labor hours roadmaps implementation</p></li><li><p>Support PFMEA</p></li><li><p>Able to read mechanical, electrical and optical drawings</p></li><li><p>Knowledge of MATLAB, LabVIEW and Python</p></li><li><p>The employee is willing to provide occasionally weekend coverage\xa0</p></li><li><p>The employee is required to work in a cleanroom environment:</p><ul><li><p>full gowning (full body coveralls, hood, CR safety shoes, face mask, nitrile gloves and safety glasses. The results of the deployment (deliverables, business impact and mindset change) are owned by the management team.</p><p></p><p>As a LEAN Expert you will respectfully challenge the status quo and act as a role model for Lean thinking, and thereby act as a change agent to help ASML’s TNF sector in the transformation towards a Lean organization.</p><p></p><h2><b>Role and responsibilities</b></h2><p>Mindset changes: transform mindsets to maintain continuous improvement efforts beyond project activities and change their way of working to a Lean way of working. Management Coaching will be one of the means to achieve such mindset shift.</p><p></p><p>Problem solving leadership: contributes to the improvement of the whole operations value stream by participating in or facilitating problem solving sessions.</p><p>Knowledge transfer: trains and coaches ASML employees &amp; management on Lean principles and behaviors.</p><p></p><p>Continuous improvements: identifies potentials for new improvements.</p><p></p><p>Business case: evaluates financial consequences of required resources to implement Lean concepts and translates the realized improvements into positive business impact.</p><p></p><p>Project leadership: co-designs and runs Lean transformations in specific areas.</p><p></p><p>Defines the overall work plan:<br />coordinates the project teams through different phases, ensures support, provides adequate status updates, shares responsibility to reach the target together with line management, enforces prerequisites for sustainability of results.</p><p></p><h2><b>Education and experience</b></h2><p>Bachelor/ Master degree with 7 yrs experience in Manufacturing (e.g. line, engineering), has a general understanding of technical topics (through technical background or job experience).<br />A passion for Continuous Improvement and exhibits a ‘there must be a better way, why don’t we try …’ mentality, can think outside the box;<br />Experience in Lean deployment or application is an absolute plus, as well as experience in Coaching.</p><p></p><h2><b>Skills</b></h2><p>Has the potential to use a range of different influencing techniques (influencing without power);<br />Actively gives and seeks constructive feedback;<br />Crisp communicator at all levels (operational – executive);<br />Is able to listen to others issues and can work in team;<br />Can train and coach others;<br />Delivers fact-based and well-structured messages in a range of different formats, e.g. presentation, written messages. {'company': 'ASML', 'job_id': 'J-00316828', 'title': 'Wilton research group lead', 'department': ['Design Engineering and Architecture'], 'location': 'Wilton, US', 'degree': ['Master'], 'experience_level': ['4-9 years'], 'description': '<h2><b>Introduction</b></h2><p></p><p>ASML US brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><p>Founded in 1984, ASML is the world’s leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or microchips. The mission of the Mechanical Development department is to design and develop the complex mechanics for these machines, which are some of the highest precision products ever produced in the world. This position is based on-site in Wilton, CT, which has both R&amp;D and manufacturing operations. We design and produce multiple sub-system modules that are shipped to our headquarters in Veldhoven, The Netherlands where they are integrated into the full lithography machine.</p><p></p><p>ASML’s Research Group in Wilton, CT is seeking a line Manager (or group lead) to lead a team of engineers and physicists to conduct Research in the area of mechatronics and optical and photonic sensor systems used within ASML’s photolithography tools. These systems typically include motors, controllers, feedback sensors, light sources, detectors, optical and electro-optical components, fiber optics, electronics and signal processing software functioning in close collaboration with the rest of the lithography system. Specifically, this person will lead and manager researchers as they generate ideas, create agreed priorities and then promote ideas for funding and project status.</p><p></p><p>We are looking for someone with a technical background, strong people leadership skills, and the drive and ownership to jump in and support their employees&#39; growth and wellbeing as well as support project deliverables as needed. This is a technical group where a complex engineering background and analytic thought are as important as inspiring leadership and people development. A background in design of metrology, processes, precision hardware, or complex optical systems is desirable, as well as good complex system and process intuition.</p><p></p><h2><b>Role and Responsibilities</b></h2><p></p><p>As direct line manager, you will partner closely with the Project Managers regarding present and future scope and timing of deliverables. Be accountable for the quality, technical integrity, and planning for on time execution of deliverables. Collaborate on project planning, attend design reviews, and review and approve technical documentation. Be responsible for hiring direct, contract, and intern/Co-Op employees. Meet regularly one on one with your team members and hold regular team meetings to provide mentoring, coaching, and career development guidance. Collect feedback, provide input to salary and promotion decisions, and deliver annual performance evaluations. You will also be challenged to identify and lead continuous improvement projects that improve the way of working, increase collaboration, and streamline our ASML processes.</p><ul><li><p>Responsible for people management and career development activities including recruiting, onboarding, training, mentoring, coaching, and performance evaluation.</p></li><li><p>Responsible for leading a group to perform conceptual design, analysis, and research of new products and innovative changes to existing products using complex or novel engineering approaches and used advanced engineering tools.</p></li><li><p>Work with multiple engineering disciplines and co-developers to ensure timely realization of competitive, serviceable products that keep the semiconductor industry moving forward.</p></li><li><p>Exposure to multi-disciplinary projects, such as mechatronics or optical systems and developing the skillsets within the Advanced Development Center organization to successfully realize leading edge complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits and microchips.</p></li><li><p>Responsible for resource management working with Project Leaders to anticipate program staffing and skillset needs and to optimally allocate work between onsite personnel and external codevelopers.</p></li><li><p>Lead continuous improvement projects to further improve the quality and efficiency of the organization.</p></li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Education and Experience</b></h2><ul><li><p>A degree in Chemical, Electrical, Mechanical or other engineering, Physics, Material Science, Mathematics or similar is required. Relevant experience required as outlined below.</p></li><li><p>Bachelor’s degree with minimum 8 years’ experience</p></li><li><p>Master’s degree with minimum 7 years’ experience</p></li><li><p>PhD with minimum 5 years’ experience;</p></li><li><p>Minimum qualifications – the hired candidate must possess all of the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for the position including:</p></li><li><p>Minimum of 3 years of direct management, project management, or similar leadership experience in a technical field.</p></li><li><p>Knowledge/hands-on experience with software/technical tools</p></li><li><p>Strong English communication skills – both written and oral, ability to influence</p></li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Skills</b></h2><p></p><p>Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. The UI is the main interface between all the departments that need to work together to make upgrades possible.</p><p></p><p><b>Roles and responsibilities </b></p><p>The Upgrade Integrator (UI) works closely with the upgrade Project Lead (PL) to plan and coordinate upgrade packages on ASML systems. Using a combination of technical and personal skills, the NPI engineers develops and maintains a relationship with our suppliers to drive the industrialization efforts of the manufacturing process of our optical components and parts. This individual works closely with the suppliers and ASML cross-sector development teams to optimize the effectiveness and efficiency of the product generation process, in alignment with the ASML project. The main goal of this cross sector activity is to secure an excellent quality of parts delivered by our suppliers.</p><p></p><p><b>Role and responsibilities</b></p><p>Within the D&amp;E organization, the Optical/Optomechanical NPI engineer is the primary person responsible for creating an optimal engineering collaboration between our optical suppliers and ASML, starting from early supplier involvement through product design and maturity. As part of the D&amp;E project team, this individual works closely with their suppliers to understand and leverage their technology and processes and integrate these processes into the ASML new product development projects to drive industrialization efforts.</p><p></p><p>NOTE: This is a technical position in a highly technical company and not a general Quality Assurance/Black Belt/Lean Manufacturing role. The ideal candidate has a combination of a strong technical/manufacturing expertise combined with a quality assurance background.</p><p>The main responsibilities are:</p><ul><li>Early supplier involvement in the D&amp;E project to secure that technology expertise of co-development and supplier are merged in the best way.</li><li>Ensure that part quality, manufacturability and serviceability aspects are covered in the design phase.</li><li>Document the D&amp;E project collaboration, including supplier &amp; co-development responsibilities and roles via a Statement of Work (SoW).</li><li>Support and own new product introduction (NPI) and support early supplier selection and engagement.</li></ul><p></p><p>Deliverables that secure parts quality from suppliers in the co-development product generation process, such as:</p><ul><li>Acceptance of the design and/or specification of complete &amp; detailed parts qualification process.</li><li>Acceptance of qualified parts.</li><li>Process flow and Process failure mode effect analysis.</li><li>First article inspection.</li></ul><p></p><p>Define and maintain supplier interface processes, such as:\xa0</p><ul><li>Issue resolution.</li><li>Qualification deviation.</li><li>Configuration management.</li><li>ASML factory disturbances.</li></ul><p></p><p>Contribute to supplier development to improve operational excellence by driving execution of existing agreements, improvement actions, and participation in supplier audits. In this position you will manage assigned suppliers and/or an overall commodity (supply base) to ensure ASML is supported by world-class suppliers delivering on time, at spec, and at the lowest total cost. You will be expected to actively pursue continuous improvement with current suppliers and potential suppliers. You will be expected to continually explore opportunities arising from process and product improvements, new technology, risk management, alternative materials and suppliers, enhancements in supply chain activities, cost reduction programs and any other opportunities that may present a competitive advantage.</p><p></p><p>ASML Sourcing &amp; Procurement (S&amp;P) represents ASML’s Sourcing, Supply Chain Management/Logistics and Quality interface to its supply base and is responsible for Materials Availability for ASML’s factories and customers. Our DNA contains customer focus, concurrent engineering, virtual integration plus the ability to thrive in a volatile market, accelerate the supply chain and deliver creative solutions.</p><p></p><p><b>Role and responsibilities</b></p><ul><li><p>Monitors developments and trends within the supply base and ensures ASML is prepared to react appropriately.</p></li><li><p>Drives supplier selection activities by leading one or more Sourcing Teams</p></li><li><p>Negotiates Long Term Supply Agreements (LTSA), NPI Agreements, and associated agreements as needed.</p></li><li><p>Monitors contractual compliance of the supplier as well as ASML.</p></li><li><p>Drives continuous cost and lead time reduction.</p></li><li><p>Prepares supplier spending forecasts.</p></li><li><p>Monitors supplier financial health.</p></li><li><p>Executes the QLTC (supplier performance measurement) process.</p></li><li><p>Prepares for, leads, and follows-up from SAT (“Supplier Account Team”) meetings.</p></li><li><p>Leverages cross functional teams for business improvements and communications.</p></li><li><p>Drives supply base rationalization within the commodity.</p></li><li><p>Participates in supplier quality audits and drives closure of findings.</p></li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Education and experience</b></h2><ul><li><p>Bachelor degree in business administration, finance, engineering or related field is required; Masters in business administration, engineering or related field is preferred.</p></li><li><p>Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in supplier management in a high-tech, international manufacturing environment.</p></li><li><p>Experience with sourcing and procurement of highly technical, complex engineered products.</p></li><li><p>Due to the strategic nature of the commodities involved, a proven track record in developing strong business relationships with key suppliers and experience in developing and executing long term agreements is required.</p></li><li><p>Experience with complex negotiations, problem solving, strategic planning and financial analysis are essential.</p></li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Skills</b></h2><p>Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.</p><p></p><p>To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:</p><p></p><ul><li><p>Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential.</p></li><li><p>Negotiation skills are critical.</p></li><li><p>Candidate needs to be able to operate effectively with all levels of management both internally and externally.</p></li><li><p>The ability to lead cross-functional teams is essential to performing the job.</p></li><li><p>Must be able to professionally represent ASML to outside companies.</p></li><li><p>Must thrive in an environment where multi-tasking is the norm. Must be proficient with Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Knowledge of Oracle/SAP is a plus.</p></li><li><p>Ability to travel domestically and internationally required.</p></li></ul><p></p><h2><b>Other information</b></h2><p></p><p>Role within Office</p><p>Responsibilities:</p><ul><li><p>Routinely required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch.\xa0</p></li><li><p>Occasionally required to move around the campus.</p></li><li><p>Occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.</p></li><li><p>May require travel dependent on business needs.</p></li><li><p>Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.</p></li></ul><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p><i>This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the</i> <i>United States</i> <i>Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). You will play a role in shaping the future of our financial operations and driving the success of ASML.</p><p></p><p>In this role, you will be jointly responsible for:</p><ul><li><b>Worldwide stakeholders</li><li><b>Process improvements</b>: Identify and implement continuous improvements for the consolidation processes and optimize related tools for greater efficiency</li><li><b>SOX We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers-the world’s leading chipmakers-to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p>The Electrical Competence Manager is the functional owner of, and responsible for ALL building electrical assets, planning and documentation (US/EURO). This includes system specifications, performance and maintenance requirements for critical electrical assets (High Voltage, Low Voltage, Switchgear, Mains, Distribution, Panels, and other critical infrastructure) associated with the ASML Wilton facilities and manufacturing systems.</p><p></p><p>The Competence Managers are the owners of the User Requirements Specifications, Engineering Design Guidelines, Maintenance Policies and Procedures, support the development of the Utility Master Plan, contribute to the Strategic Industrial Masterplan (SIM), perform feasibility studies, provide leadership and guidance in establishing and documenting local competence knowledge and/ or standards of the Wilton campus. All in an effort to align with ASML strategic business and production output requirements.</p><p></p><p>In order to enable ASML’s vision, the Facilities Management (FM) department, part of the Corporate Real Estate (CRE) organization, strives to maintain a consistent set of physical assets through its complete lifecycle to support the production process of ASML in an optimal manner. In addition, CRE FM is responsible to manage all buildings, grounds and services with the aim to contribute to an appealing, attractive and comfortable working environment for ASML employees and visitors. Our joint CRE strategic pillars Safety, Total cost of ownership, Flexibility, Business alignment, Wellbeing and Sustainability guide us in our plans and activities.</p><p></p><p>The Electrical Competence Manager ensures effective and successful Operations, Maintenance and Support of Facilities and Operational services and decisions. These transitions should be derived from and contributing to the strategic pillars.</p><p></p><h2><b>Role and responsibilities</b></h2><ul><li><p>Routinely required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch. Occasionally required to move around the campus.\xa0</p></li><li><p>Occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.\xa0</p></li><li><p>May require travel dependent on business needs.\xa0</p></li><li><p>Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.\xa0</p></li></ul><p></p><p>The Facilities Electrical Engineer is responsible for ensuring the reliability, safety, and efficiency of electrical distribution systems within a manufacturing facility. This role supports maintenance operations and capital projects, providing expertise in medium and low-voltage power distribution (601V–69kV) with high-voltage knowledge (69kV–230kV) as a plus. The engineer will work closely with internal teams, contractors, and suppliers to develop and maintain robust electrical infrastructure, ensuring compliance with industry standards and business continuity.</p><p><b>Electrical Systems &amp; Maintenance Support:</b></p><ul><li>Oversee design, operation, and maintenance of <b>medium (601V–69kV) and low-voltage (≤600V) electrical distribution systems</b>, with high-voltage (69kV–230kV) knowledge as a plus.</li><li>Support <b>preventive and predictive maintenance</b> for electrical infrastructure, ensuring compliance with reliability best practices.</li><li>Provide <b>technical oversight</b> for power system components, including switchgear, transformers, emergency/backup power systems, and UPS.</li><li>Troubleshoot electrical system issues, conduct root cause analysis, and recommend corrective actions.</li></ul><p><b>Project Engineering &amp; Infrastructure Planning:</b></p><ul><li>Develop electrical system <b>master plans</b> to support facility growth and capacity planning.</li><li>Lead <b>capital and infrastructure projects</b>, ensuring alignment with business needs, safety codes, and performance objectives.</li><li>Review electrical system designs, specifications, and contractor work for compliance with <b>IEEE, NEC, NFPA, and corporate standards</b>.</li><li>Coordinate system upgrades, expansions, and modifications with engineering teams and external service providers.</li></ul><p><b>Compliance, Safety &amp; Risk Management:</b></p><ul><li>Ensure adherence to <b>NFPA 70E, OSHA, and local electrical codes</b>, driving a strong electrical safety culture.</li><li>Develop and review <b>Method of Procedures (MOPs)</b> for critical system work, ensuring safe execution of electrical maintenance and upgrades.</li><li>Perform <b>arc flash studies, coordination studies, and load flow analysis</b> to mitigate electrical hazards.</li><li>Implement <b>redundancy and reliability improvements</b> to minimize power disruptions and support business continuity.</li></ul><p><b>Collaboration &amp; Communication:</b></p><ul><li>Partner with Facilities, Maintenance, EHS, and Production teams to ensure seamless power distribution.</li><li>Provide <b>technical guidance</b> to maintenance personnel and project managers on electrical systems.</li><li>Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders and external contractors to resolve issues and optimize electrical performance.</li></ul><p><b>Performance Criteria:</b></p><ul><li><b>System Reliability:</b> Maintain electrical system uptime at <b>99.5% or higher</b>.</li><li><b>Project Execution:</b> Deliver infrastructure projects on time, within budget, and to specification.</li><li><b>Safety &amp; Compliance:</b> Ensure 100% compliance with NFPA 70E, OSHA, and NEC regulations.</li><li><b>Energy Efficiency:</b> Identify and implement energy-saving initiatives with measurable cost reductions.</li></ul><p><b>Experience and education</b></p><ul><li><b>Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering</b> (Master’s preferred).</li><li><b>10&#43; years of experience</b> in an industrial/manufacturing setting.</li><li>Strong working knowledge of <b>medium-voltage (601V–69kV) and low-voltage (≤600V) systems</b>, with <b>high-voltage (69kV–230kV) experience as a plus</b>.</li><li>Proficiency in <b>electrical power distribution, emergency power systems, load flow analysis, and protective relay coordination</b>.</li><li>Ability to <b>read, interpret, and develop electrical drawings, schematics, and single-line diagrams</b>.</li><li>Familiarity with <b>CMMS systems</b> for tracking maintenance and work orders.</li><li><b>NFPA 70E certification required</b>; Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred.</li><li>Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, with ability to <b>write clear reports, procedures, and technical documents</b>.</li><li>Experience working with <b>external vendors, contractors, and regulatory bodies</b>.</li></ul><p><b>Stakeholder Relationships:</b></p><p>The Facilities Electrical Engineer collaborates with maintenance teams, project engineers, EHS personnel, and external suppliers to optimize electrical infrastructure. This role acts as a technical lead for electrical reliability and compliance, ensuring seamless operation of manufacturing facilities.</p><p></p><h2>Other information</h2><ul><li><p>This position is located on-site in Wilton, CT.\xa0It requires onsite presence to attend in-person work-related events, trainings and meetings and to further ensure teamwork, collaboration and innovation.</p></li><li><p><i>This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p></p><p>This position is for a Group Lead (Manager) to manage the department in EUV Production Engineering (PE) responsible for the EXE Top Module. Manager is expected to have an innovative attitude to work in Manufacturing Engineering, and the ability to manage engineers of varying disciplines and backgrounds. Our San Diego-based light source division, Cymer, is renowned for developing both deep ultraviolet (DUV) lithography light sources and next generation extreme ultraviolet (EUV) light sources. \xa0 We are a multinational company with over 70 locations in 16 countries, headquartered in Veldhoven, the Netherlands.</p><p></p><p>If you have a passion for technology and innovation you’ll want to check us out. Be a part of ASML. Be a part of progress.</p><p></p><p><i>One Company, One Goal, Limitless Innovation. It&#39;s our people that make the difference.</i><br />\xa0</p><h2>Role and responsibilities</h2><p>We are seeking a <b>Proto Integrator</b> to join our EUV System Test and Integration group. You will be part of an interdisciplinary team that tests and integrates our EUV systems for Development and Engineering (D&amp;E). Our EUV light source consists of an intricate network of process gases, high power lasers, optics, electronics, mechatronics, and control systems. \xa0As the leader of a Machine Integration Team (MIT), your role as a Proto Integrator is key to building a better product though testing, issue identification and resolution, and finding potential design and process improvements. \xa0\xa0In this project management position you will have the opportunity to lead a team of dedicated EUV light source generalists as design validation, upgrades, and test activities are conducted, working to support the deliverables of individual project owners and in accordance to an approved high-level plan or agreed customer escalation.\xa0</p><p></p><h2>Responsibilities</h2><ul><li><p>Contributor for maintaining a safe work environment through review of proposed work, testing, and containment actions.</p></li><li><p>Plans and drives preventive maintenance and upgrades of equipment as required components.</p></li><li><p>Ensures assigned Machine Integration Team and other D&amp;E resources capture and drive the identification, containment, and resolution of issues to ensure a quality product is delivered.</p></li><li><p>Leverages available and assigned resources to proactively solve problems through troubleshooting.</p></li><li><p>Drives the improvement of procedures and processes, both in San Diego Integration and ASML.</p></li><li><p>Works with stakeholders from different departments and builds a strong communication network.</p></li><li><p>Assesses and highlights risks and develops mitigation plans.</p></li><li><p>Travel to customer sites as required to support product introduction or support local sites.</p></li><li><p>Collaborates with cross-functional teams using effective communication methods.</p></li><li><p>Accountable for managing the system configuration using existing process and methodology.</p></li><li><p>Supports post-mortem reviews on key developments and drives necessary changes into the PGP or other applicable process areas, such as build, operation, upgrades, and decommissioning processes.</p></li><li><p>Interprets, implements, and monitors modifications to department methods, processes and policies that affect multiple work groups.</p></li><li><p>May provide in-depth reporting to management or internal and external customers.</p></li><li><p>Provides input and plans for program related expenses to the Integration Project Lead for Program budget development and forecasting.</p></li><li><p>Creates reports, status updates, and presentations as required to support internal and external program reviews.</p></li><li><p>Performs other duties as assigned.</p></li></ul><h2></h2><h2>Education and experience</h2><ul><li><p>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering discipline or Physics.</p></li><li><p>2&#43; years of relevant experience.</p></li><li><p>Knowledge of electronics, gas and commitments.</p></li><li><p>Ability to define and track short and long-term project goals and resources.</p></li></ul><p></p><h2>Other information</h2><p>Physical Demands and Work Environment</p><p>The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.</p><ul><li><p>Work is mainly in an office environment but partially and frequently in a cleanroom setting with full gown, veil, hood, gloves, and boots.</p></li><li><p>The office space can be in a cubicle setting or activity-based workspace.</p></li><li><p>This is not a remote work position.</p></li><li><p>Routinely required to walk, talk, hear, lift, feel, crouch, reach, and stretch.</p></li><li><p>Routinely required to wear personal protective equipment including safety glasses, hearing protection, safety shoes, and laser safety glasses.</p></li><li><p>The employee is occasionally required to move around the campus.\xa0</p></li><li><p>The employee will occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.</p></li><li><p>Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.</p></li><li><p>The environment generally is moderate in temperature and noise level.</p></li><li><p>Must be capable of working in the lab at floor level to 8 feet high with appropriate ladder.</p></li><li><p>May require use of respirator apparatus.</p></li></ul><p></p><p></p><p></p><p>The current base annual salary range for this role is currently:</p>$86,250-143,750<p>Pay scales are determined by role, level, location and alignment with market data. Individual pay is determined through interviews and an assessment of several factors that that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, relevant education and experience, certifications, abilities of the candidate and pay relative to other team members.</p><p>The Company offers employees and their families, medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees are able to participate in the Company’s 401k plan. Employees will also receive eight (8) hours of vacation leave every month and (13) paid holidays throughout the calendar year. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our main headquarters are located in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.</p><p>\xa0</p><p><b>Role and Responsibilities</b></p><p>As a US Customer supply chain Sr. Specialist EXE you will be responsible for:</p><ul><li><p>Communicating in a matrixed organization, proactively identifying supply gaps, developing an action plan to mitigate those gaps.</p></li><li><p>Identifying the need to escalate and following the escalation path in a timely manner.</p></li><li><p>Deciphering demand and determining the best viable options to meet needs in a supply constrained environment.</p></li><li><p>Creatively solving problems under extreme pressure and with urgent timelines.</p></li><li><p>Completing root cause analyses to develop a systemic solutions.</p></li><li><p>Analyzing global supply forecast against local customer.</p></li><li><p>Demand &amp; {'company': 'ASML', 'job_id': 'J-00318351', 'title': 'Mechanical Design Engineer', 'department': ['Design Engineering and Architecture'], 'location': 'Wilton, US', 'degree': ['Bachelor', 'Master'], 'experience_level': ['0-1 year', '2-3 years'], 'description': '<p><b>Introduction to the job</b>\xa0</p><p>ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.\xa0</p><p>Founded in 1984, ASML is the world’s leading provider of lithography systems for the semiconductor industry, manufacturing complex machines that are critical to the production of integrated circuits or microchips. The mission of the Mechanical Development department is to design and develop the complex mechanics for these machines, which are some of the highest precision products ever produced in the world. This position is based on-site in Wilton, CT, which has both R&amp;D and manufacturing operations. We design and produce multiple sub-system modules that are shipped to our headquarters in Veldhoven, The Netherlands where they are integrated into the full lithography machine.\xa0</p><p>\xa0</p><p><i>This position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). As a condition of employment, qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require the Company to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.</i>\xa0</p><p>\xa0</p><p><b>Role and responsibilities</b>\xa0</p><p>As a Mechanical Design Engineer, you will be responsible for developing portions of the lithography system and/or associated tooling. You will work on sub-systems involving robotics, mechatronics, precision mechanics, and/or optomechanics. Precision machine design at ASML starts with understanding the functional requirements and deriving specifications. You will collaborate with system architects in a multidiscipline project team to develop concepts, perform engineering analysis, build and test prototypes, generate detailed CAD designs, create engineering drawings, partner with suppliers, and support system integration and testing.\xa0</p><p>This position is located on-site in Wilton, CT. It requires onsite presence to attend in-person work-related events, trainings and meetings and to further ensure teamwork, collaboration and innovation.\xa0</p><p>\xa0</p><p><b>Education and experience</b>\xa0</p><p>Minimum of a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering and must have project or work experience that includes mechanical design.\xa0</p><p>The hired candidate must have ability to communicate effectively in the English language both written and oral.\xa0</p><p>We are seeking an individual with a strong background in mechanical design and engineering, including taking responsibility of the full “art to part” development cycle. A background in mechanical design of mechatronics, precision design, or complex optical systems is desirable, as well as good complex mechanical system intuition.\xa0\xa0</p><p>Preferred skills for this job include:\xa0</p><ul><li><p>Mechanical design exposure to kinematics, dynamics, material properties and behavior, and structural analysis.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Experience with 3D solid modelling for design conceptualization and realization.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Basic experience with mechanical analytical techniques, including “first principle” engineering equations and Finite Element Analysis such as stress, strain, deformation, modal response, etc.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Demonstrated ability to derive conclusions from analysis and make practical recommendations.\xa0</p></li></ul><ul><li><p>Strong technical writing, communication and presentations skills.\xa0</p></li></ul><p>\xa0</p><p><b>Skills</b>\xa0</p><p>Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. We manufacture complex lithography machines used by chip manufacturers to produce integrated circuits or computer chips. It is essential that ASML&#39;s property, plants and equipment, buildings, real estate and services are maintained at a consistently high level to realize our growth targets. The Corporate Real Estate (CRE) organization is a centralized department that is responsible for CRE activities worldwide, serving more than 40,000 employees.</p><p></p><p><u><b>Role and responsibilities (Job Mission)</b></u></p><p>\xa0As part of Corporate Real Estate (CRE) team, the EHS Specialist will be responsible to manage the Environment, Health and Safety across the CRE Korea/Japan region. It would be mainly focused on the Occupational Safety and Environment in ASML owned facilities including manufacturing site, cleanrooms and project sites. EHS Specialist’s core task is to optimize the operation to comply with the local regulations and ASML EHS guidelines.</p><p></p><p>\xa0In collaboration with the procurement &amp; sourcing team, ensures the necessary capacity and capabilities in the supplier base and monitor their performance. (S)He drives continuous improvements with the suppliers. (S)He defines budgets, create forecasts and approve expense. Focus on the financial- &amp; performance management, and contract development.</p><p>\xa0EHS Specialist is responsible for the establishment of the EHS Management system, also defines the Health and Safety coordination of the project portfolios ensuring compliance. (S)he manages a portfolio of studies that originate from operational disturbances or incidents where proper preventive actions need to be investigated and defined, and works closely with the Hard Service, Soft Service and Project Management team to optimize the execution of planned operation activities without effecting business continuity.</p><p>\xa0As part of the team, (s)he will contribute to continuously improve the EHS management standards and procedures. And (s)he will report to the CRE global region(Korea and Japan) management.</p><p></p><p><u><b>Job Task</b></u></p><p><b>•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Establish and maintain the EHS Management system in Korea/Japan region</b></p><ul><li>Implement and maintain the process/procedures(L4 – L5) and streamline the applicable methods/protocols used in the field(ASML premises, construction sites, field offices, etc.)</li><li>Manage, monitor and maintain the required operation permits of CRE activities</li><li>Ensuring a high quality of EHS advice to the team to mitigate the potential risks in the technical competence areas(e.g electrical safety, hazardous materials, ergonomics, waste, energy, CO2 emissions, Life Cycle Assessment, etc.)</li><li>Manage the incident reporting procedures(e.g incident investigations, risk ranking, improvement action support, etc.)</li><li>Develop and maintain emergency preparedness and response plans</li><li>Act as an EHS SPOC in construction projects from design phase to execution phase to mitigate the risks</li></ul><p></p><p><b>•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Ensure the EHS Compliance and data reporting</b></p><ul><li>Ensure compliance with ISO 14001, local environmental, safety and health laws and corporate EHS standards</li><li>Conduct the inspection and find the opportunity for improvement to mitigate the risks in the workplace</li><li>Own the EHS evaluate the likelihood and impact of hazards</li><li>Propose control measures using the hierarchy of controls</li><li>Work with Hard Service, Soft Service team to implement safety solutions</li></ul><p></p><p><b>•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Develop and implement environmental procedures and sustainability programs</b></p><ul><li>Conduct environmental impact assessments to evaluate the
